data.question: What type of macrocycle was used as the organic ligand for the synthesis of copper(II)- and zinc(II)-based metal–organic frameworks?
data.answer: A flexible benzylic amide macrocycle functionalized with two carboxylic acid groups.

data.question: What was the remarkable solvent-accessible volume percentage of the synthesized metal–organic frameworks?
What was the main advantage of using large macrocycles as ligands in the synthesis of metal–organic frameworks?
data.answer: The presence of large and well-ordered recognition cavities, highly valuable for the establishment of noncovalent interactions with suitable guests.

data.question: What was the yield of the light blue discorectangle-shaped crystals of the CuII-based polymer named UMUMOF 5a?
What was the method used to successfully incorporate fullerene C60 inside the metal–organic frameworks?
data.answer: Soaking crystals in a C60 saturated toluene solution at 60 88C.

data.question: What was the loading percentage of C60 in UMUMOF 5a after the incorporation process?
True or False: The synthesized metal–organic frameworks were able to incorporate pure C70 under the tested conditions.
What was the calculated occupation percentage of the UMUMOF 5 cavities in C60@5a?
True or False: The synthesized metal–organic frameworks showed higher selectivity for C60 over C70 in competitive loading experiments.
What was the effect of incorporating C60 into the metal–organic frameworks on the structure according to computational studies?
data.answer: The presence of the fullerene induced a structural distortion in the crystalline array, maximizing the p-p stacking interactions with the fullerene.

data.question: True or False: The synthesized metal–organic frameworks maintained their crystalline structure after thermal activation.
What was the main weight loss temperature range observed in the thermogravimetric analyses for both materials?
True or False: The synthesized metal–organic frameworks could not be reused after releasing the encapsulated C60.
What was the method that allowed a quick and complete release of C60 from inside the frameworks but caused a partial collapse of the polymeric network?
data.answer: Method A, which involved immersing the C60 loaded UMUMOFs in carbon disulfide.

data.question: True or False: The angle between two macrocyclic units linked to the same cluster in UMUMOF 5a was 77.588.
What was the main challenge in the recognition of relatively large molecules by metal–organic frameworks according to the text?
data.answer: The difficulty of the bulky guests to diffuse into the network pores.

data.question: True or False: The synthesized metal–organic frameworks showed a robust thermal stability according to thermogravimetric analyses.
What was the main reaction product in the synthesis of benzylic amide macrocycles?
True or False: The synthesized metal–organic frameworks were able to selectively recognize and encapsulate different fullerenes.
What was the main advantage of the absence of the thread in the novel reticular materials compared to metal–organic rotaxane frameworks?
data.answer: An increase in flexibility and a larger pore size.
